description.para: Gets the amount of time the associated process has spent on utilizing the CPU.

param_note.para: The total amount of time, the associated process has spent on executing in the application portion (Not including the amount of time the process has spent on the OS kernel portion), in milliseconds. When pUserTime is NULL, it means to ignore this parameter.
The total amount of time, the process has spent on running a chunk of code inside the operating system core, in milliseconds. When pPrivilegedTime is NULL, it means to ignore this parameter.

tr.td: Function succeeds in getting the amount of time the process has spent on utilizing the CPU

return.para: See ECODE related help for more details.

remarks.para: The pUserTime and pPrivilegedTime constitute the amount of time, that the associated process has spent on utilizing the CPU, in milliseconds.

system.system_name: Windows 2000 or later; Elastos 2.0 or later.
